verses.text: 耶穌受試探（太4:1~11；可1:12~13）耶穌被聖靈充滿，從約旦河回來，聖靈引他到曠野，四十天受魔鬼的試探。

words.note: Refers to a spiritual trial or challenge.
Abbreviation for 馬太福音 (Mǎtài Fúyīn, Gospel of Matthew).
Abbreviation for 馬可福音 (Mǎkě Fúyīn, Gospel of Mark).

verses.text: 那些日子他甚麼也沒有吃，日子滿了他就餓了。

words.note: Here 'filled/completed' refers to the days being over.

verses.text: 魔鬼對他說：「你若是　神的兒子，就吩咐這塊石頭變成食物吧！」

words.note: The raised square indicates reverence for the divine name.
Indicates suggestion or a softened command.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「經上記著：『人活著不是單靠食物。』」

words.note: A common biblical phrase for 'in the Scriptures'.

verses.text: 魔鬼引他上到高處，霎時間把天下萬國指給他看，

words.definition: in an instant, in a flash

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
Literally 'under heaven'; often refers to the whole world.
Verb-complement structure: 'point (and give to him)' implies showing him.

verses.text: 對他說：「這一切權柄、榮華，我都可以給你；因為這些都交給了我，我願意給誰就給誰。

words.note: Lit. 'power handle'; often used in religious contexts.
Often refers to earthly glory or wealth.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Used to connect two clauses, implying consequence or immediate action.

verses.text: 所以，只要你在我面前拜一拜，這一切就全是你的了。」

words.note: Repetition indicates a brief or singular action of bowing/worshiping.
Indicates a new situation or completion.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「經上記著：『當拜主你的　神，單要事奉他。』」

words.note: Implies an ongoing state of being written or recorded.
Refers to God or Jesus in a religious context.
Emphasizes exclusivity or strict requirement.
Often used in the context of serving God or a ruler.

verses.text: 魔鬼又引他到耶路撒冷，叫他站在殿的最高處，對他說：「你若是　神的兒子，就從這裡跳下去吧！

words.note: Indicates a suggestion, command, or request.

verses.text: 因為經上記著：『他為了你，會吩咐自己的使者保護你。』

words.note: Indicates future tense or ability.

verses.text: 又記著：『用手托住你，免得你的腳碰到石頭。』」
耶穌回答：「經上說：『不可試探主你的　神。』」

words.note: Often used in religious context of testing God.
Refers to God or Jesus in Christian texts.
An ideographic space, often used to signify reverence for God.

verses.text: 魔鬼用盡了各種試探，就暫時離開了耶穌。
在加利利傳道（太4:12~17；可1:14~15）耶穌帶著聖靈的能力，回到加利利。他的名聲傳遍了周圍各地。

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 他在各會堂裡教導人，很受眾人的尊崇。

words.note: Implies high reverence, often used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 在本鄉遭人厭棄（太13:53~58；可6:1~6）耶穌來到拿撒勒自己長大的地方，照著習慣在安息日進入會堂，站起來要讀經。

words.note: Abbreviation for 馬太福音 (Mǎtài Fúyīn, Gospel of Matthew)
Abbreviation for 馬可福音 (Mǎkě Fúyīn, Gospel of Mark)

verses.text: 有人把以賽亞先知的書遞給他，他展開書卷找到一處，上面寫著：
「主的靈在我身上，因為他膏我去傳福音給貧窮的人，差遣我去宣告被擄的得釋放，瞎眼的得看見，受壓制的得自由，

words.note: 福音 (fúyīn) means 'good news'
Used here as a nominalized verb, 'those who are captured'.

verses.text: 又宣告主悅納人的禧年。」

words.note: Refers to the Jubilee year in ancient Israel.

verses.text: 他把書卷捲好，交還侍役，就坐下。會堂裡眾人都注視他。
他就對他們說：「這段經文今天應驗在你們中間（「中間」原文作「耳中」）了。」

words.note: Refers to a passage of scripture.
Often used for prophecy fulfillment.
Indicates how the original text is phrased.

verses.text: 眾人稱讚他，希奇他口中所出的恩言，並且說：「這不是約瑟的兒子嗎？」

words.note: Similar to '驚奇' (jīngqí), meaning surprised/amazed.
Forms a nominalized verb phrase.
Refers to words full of grace and favor.

verses.text: 他說：「你們必向我說這俗語：『醫生，治好你自己吧！』也必說：『我們聽見你在迦百農所行的一切事，也該在你本鄉這裡行啊！』」

words.note: Indicates certainty or strong obligation.

verses.text: 他又說：「我實在告訴你們，沒有先知在他本鄉是受歡迎的。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 我對你們說實話，當以利亞的時候，三年六個月不下雨（「不下雨」原文作「天閉塞」），遍地大起饑荒，那時以色列中有許多寡婦，

words.note: Similar to '在...時候'.
Describes the sky being closed off, preventing rain.
Often used in biblical or classical contexts.
Indicates a significant occurrence.
Refers to the people/nation of Israel here.

verses.text: 以利亞沒有奉差遣往他們中間任何一個那裡去，只到西頓撒勒法的一個寡婦那裡。

words.definition: did not have, there was not

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for being sent on a mission.

verses.text: 以利沙先知的時候，以色列中有許多患痲風的人，其中除了敘利亞的乃縵，沒有一個得潔淨的。」

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.

words.definition: did not have, there was not

words.note: Refers to ritual or spiritual purification.

verses.text: 會堂裡的眾人聽見這話，都怒氣填胸，
起來趕他出城（這城原來建在山上），他們拉他到山崖，要把他推下去。

words.definition: out of the city, leave city

verses.text: 耶穌卻從他們中間走過，就離去了。
在迦百農趕出污靈（可1:21~28）耶穌下到加利利的迦百農城，在安息日教導人。

words.note: A verb-complement structure meaning to drive something out.

verses.text: 他們對他的教訓都很驚奇，因為他的話帶著權柄。

words.note: Literally 'power handle', referring to the symbol or instrument of power.

verses.text: 會堂裡有一個被污鬼附著的人，大聲喊叫：

words.note: Often used to describe demonic possession in biblical context.

verses.text: 「哎！拿撒勒人耶穌，我們跟你有甚麼關係呢？你來毀滅我們嗎？我知道你是誰，你是　神的聖者。」

words.note: Refers to Jesus, specifying his origin from Nazareth.
An empty character used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence before names like God (神) or Lord (主).

verses.text: 耶穌斥責他說：「住口！從他身上出來！」鬼把那人摔倒在眾人中間，就從他身上出來了，沒有傷害他。

words.note: A command literally meaning 'stop mouth'.
Often used idiomatically to mean 'from' a person.
Often used idiomatically to mean 'from' a person.

verses.text: 眾人都驚駭，彼此談論說：「這是怎麼回事？他用權柄能力吩咐污靈，污靈竟出來了。」

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine or delegated authority.

verses.text: 耶穌的名聲，傳遍了周圍各地。
治好患病的人（太8:14~17；可1:29~34）他起身離開會堂，進入西門的家。西門的岳母正在發高熱，他們為她求耶穌。

words.note: Short for '馬太福音' (Gospel of Matthew).

words.pinyin: bā shí sì dào shí qī

words.note: Short for '馬可福音' (Gospel of Mark).

words.pinyin: yī èr jiǔ dào sān sì

words.note: Refers to Jewish houses of worship.

words.definition: in the process of, just now

verses.text: 耶穌站在她旁邊，斥責那熱病，熱就退了；她立刻起身服事他們。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for casting out or commanding.
Commonly used in religious contexts for serving God or others.

verses.text: 日落的時候，不論害甚麼病的人，都被帶到耶穌那裡；他一一為他們按手，醫好他們。

words.note: A gesture in religious practice, often for blessing or healing.

verses.text: 又有鬼從好些人身上出來，喊著說：「你是　神的兒子。」耶穌斥責他們，不許他們說話，因為他們知道他是基督。

words.note: Contextually refers to an evil spirit or demon.
The empty space indicates reverence for God.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to speak'.

verses.text: 往別的城傳道（可1:35~39）天一亮，耶穌出來，到曠野地方去。眾人尋找他，一直找到他那裡，要留住他，不要他離開他們。

words.note: Verb-object compound referring to preaching the gospel or religious teachings.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Mark.
Commonly refers to a deserted or wild area in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 他卻說：「我也必須到別的城去傳　神國的福音，因為我是為了這緣故奉差遣的。」

words.note: The empty space indicates reverence for God.
Literally 'blessed news'.
Implies being sent under divine authority or command.
Used to emphasize the preceding clause as a reason or explanation.

verses.text: 於是他往猶太的各會堂去傳道。

words.note: A place of assembly, specifically for Jewish worship and teaching.
Verb-object compound referring to preaching the gospel or religious teachings.
